ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to use the darkroom, how to shoot in black and white, history of photography, how to take better pictures with better attention to form
I learned how to use a film camera, develop film, and print it. I also learned how to develop my own photography style and put together a final group of photos that represented my work.

I learned a tremendous amount through this class. In terms of direct, hands-on skills: I learned how to shoot photos on a film camera with film, how to develop film, how to use a dark room, how make prints and wash prints with film, special silver paper, and an enlarger. We also had a wonderful opportunity to be introduced to a wide array of photographic styles, as well as the history of photography, and had visiting artists, and go to the special arts collection. Most importantly, this class taught me how to better think like a photographer and make compelling photos. I learned how to think more deeply about composition and subject, and push myself into new areas of photo taking.
How to capture and develop black and white photographs.
I learned how to use a completely manual film camera (Pentax k1000), how to develop my own negatives, and how to create and develop my own prints!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: don't think the format can be improved. covid semester made it so there were only two critiques so more would be helpful, but that is not due to the course management. help is there if you need it

strengths:
- Ben is always available to give feedback
- dark room time was fun
- paper was provided 
- engaging class
Weaknesses:
- longer lectures were hard to stay focused during
- dark room closed on Fridays and Saturdays, which some of the few days I have time in my schedule to go.

The class was really strong in providing a tremendous amount of freedom to explore photography and build our own styles and viewpoints. I also really appreciated the time and ability to learn how to shoot in black and white. I am not sure the course could be substantially improved beyond its present form. I really enjoyed it!

This course is amazing and I hope to take what Ive learned with me and continue developing my own photos as a hobby in the future. Its so rewarding to be able to do the entire process on your own and inspiring to be around others who are going through the same process.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, you learn how to shoot in film and use the dark room. really great skills, ben is a great instructor.
Yes! I loved this class. The art and photography program is wonderful. Ben was always there to help and the process of film photography is amazing.

This class was phenomenal and couldn't recommend enough! The instructor was ABSOLUTELY phenomenalone of the best professors I've had. Ben had such a great way to bringing excitement and energy to the class room, had a real way of identifying how to identify great creative directions for your work. If you can take it with Ben, you must. 

Beyond that, I really improved my photo taking skills, and learned how to think about composition and using light to make more compelling photos than when I began. The amount of growth was tremendous!
Absolutely, you develop a skill that is slowly disappearing amongst the general public and it provides a new lens on life (puns intended).
Yes! You will learn so much and have fun while doing it. Its a really rewarding class
